reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our first vacations in Punta Cana.Couldn´t be better.excellent hotel, great food,great rooms ,amazing beach and pool.The dominicans are something.....kind,and very very friendly.It was the best 7 days of the last years.I really recommend these hotel.(September is the best time because the hotel it´s not completly full)Here some pretty photos of our fun.
reviews.title: Ask for more

reviews.text: We have just returned from a really good two week stay from 16th to 30th August. We were a party of six, including two over-70s and two younger teens and we all loved it. I have read mixed reviews on this hotel but I think our rep's advice was sound - remember that you are in the Caribbean and everything happens at a much slower pace than we are used to. So 5 minutes 'Dominican time' is not literally 5 minutes. Accept this before you start and you will have few problems.
reviews.title: great holiday

likes.liked: — the spaciousness of the rooms and hotel grounds
likes.disliked: — the neglected state of repair in the rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Sirenis is very well designed and the grounds are beautifully maintained. Employees are constantly washing down the walkways and even clearing small twigs from the grass. There are beautiful flowers and our children loved the flamingoes and geckos.
reviews.title: We loved it but make your own mind up!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Something we really appreciated was that the hotel, the grounds and swimming pool are so large that you never had the feeling of being in a crowd and never had to queue, either in the buffet restaurants, bars or pool bars.
reviews.title: Don't be fool by the ads

likes.liked: — The pool, however it was not clean.....

reviews.text: There were plenty of sunloungers but to guarantee one in the shade you needed to get up early and reserve them with towels!!
reviews.title: Lovely holiday would return

likes.liked: — You need to get a convertor from 110v to 240v if you want phone charger to work

reviews.text: Hi we just arrived this morning from Punta Cana , this hotel is a 4 star at it's best . The rooms feel smaller with it divided into a sitting room and bedroom. One of our party had a room in A section that was a regular hotel room with 2 double beds and it felt larger . We had a chance to try 4 a la carte restaurants. For me the Steak house had the best food .We had steak and spare ribs .The Jade was realy fun with the chef cooking in front of you . Here we had chicken , beef , rice , vegetables and shrimps. The Mexican was ok but we didn't know the know what to order and the had a hard time explaining them to us. Our worst was the Italian .
reviews.title: 4 stars

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach is great , nice sand and waves to play in . They do need to put more huts on the beach . This was our 8th trip down south and I had never seen so many people arguing over saving
reviews.title: All Inclusive! No Problem!

likes.liked: — All inclusive paradise! Drink (great rum and coffee) and smoke (fine cigars) everywhere.
likes.disliked: — Having to plan around restaurant hours.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: chairs . It was realy bad , they would put a string around the leg of a chair and say that it was their chairs. Others tied chairs together with bandanas .And some others would leave empty bottle of sunblock and water toys on chairs all night . The staff never moved any thing off the chairs as they would rearrange them at 6 pm. This was the worst we had ever seen . And it put a sour tast in our mouths for this resort.
reviews.title: Great Spot!

reviews.text: The staff is realy nice and they all work realy hard .
reviews.title: Great resort !!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I think we've now set the bar too high for all of our future vacations! My wife and I stayed at the Sirenis for a week over Christmas and it was our first major trip as a couple. We never really had a honeymoon, so this was our "unofficial" honeymoon. Wow! Did we ever have a great time.
reviews.title: Wonderful Vacation

likes.liked: — how easy it was to get around
likes.disliked: — No alarm clocks- to far from airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: stayed here at the cocotal side nov 5th -12th and let me say that i was blown away by the whole experience!!!!
reviews.title: best vacation i've ever been on

likes.liked: — atmosphere , friendly staff , pool bar , mamajuana

reviews.text: getting there was the only negative thing the entire week!
reviews.title: Best value for your money

likes.liked: — Restaurant, buffet service, friendliness of staff

reviews.text: we were supposed to fly out of toronto(with skyservice) at 6:45 am mon and our flite was cancelled until 4:45pm mon . didnt get there until around 11:50pm monday night but from the minute we stepped in the resort , all that frustration dissappeared . check in was a breeze , no problems , even enjoyed a drink while we were getting checked in.
reviews.title: Fantastic Vacation....Loved the Sirenis!!!!

likes.liked: — beautiful large beach, clean pool, great location

reviews.text: the room was pretty good , very clean (looked as if they had been reno'd recently) cleaning service came everyday and did an excellent job of keeping it maintained . the only negatives about our room was the beds were very hard (but expected) and the bathroom mirror was old and had some spots on it(this was no big deal to me though but i know for some , it could ruin a trip )
reviews.title: A place for the whole family!

likes.disliked: — The immediate neighbours of the hotel that let garbage on the soil

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we had 3 ppl in our room and only 2 towels and all that had to be done was ask the maidservice for an extra towel , no worries!
reviews.title: Maybe a 2 stars

reviews.text: Look out for Sirenis tropical, I have never seen such a dirty 5 star low classed resort. The fountains by the main building were flooded always and looked like a swamp, the railings along the buffet retaurants were broken and rotten, the metal railings on the stair cases to the rooms were also all rotten.
reviews.title: low class 3 star
a New year's worth remembering
reviews.text: The room was dirty with dead bugs all over the walls, broken equipement in the room, light bulbs that were broken and left in the socket to rust, rust and mold all around the bathtub and doors. The maid never replaced towels unless we called the front desk time after time.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon arrival we had no bedding for the two kids single cots. The door leading into our room was broken and was difficult to open.
reviews.title: Average Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurants were ok if you like fast food and didn't mind eating the samething day after day. The reservation booth was a joke, no resevations in advance,but a man before me on the Thursday before leaving was reserving a spot for Monday, Imagine!
reviews.title: Boring....

reviews.text: The seating at the beach was horrilble, we litterly had to rise at 6am to reserve loungers for the day with two kids.
reviews.title: Not a 5-star hotel - but a good 3-star standard

likes.liked: — Close proximity to sea and shows every night. Quite OK food. Drinks where also OK.
likes.disliked: — Quite tatty hotel, very difficult to get a beach bed, the pond smelt, overall a musty smell in the reception

reviews.text: Maybe not for couples that want to be far from their childs for a moment because other kids will splash them while they wait for their drink at the poolside bar!
reviews.title: The best time ever!!! Cannot wait to go back in February

reviews.text: The bus trip from the airport to the resort is a bit long (approx 1 hour) but it worth the wait!
reviews.title: Great time at Tropical !!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: EXCELLENT service from the hotel staff. Everybody says Hola! when they meet you.
reviews.title: Locals! Locals! Friday to Sunday

likes.disliked: — overcrowded Friday to Sunday with staff and/or locals

reviews.text: Last year (March 07), was my first time to Punta Cana. We stayed at Barcelo Premium. I thought THAT was amazing until I stayed at the Sirenis Tropical this March!
reviews.title: Outstanding Vacation

likes.liked: — The attention to every detail, large and small, evidenced by all levels of staff
likes.disliked: — Electrical plugs - could have been a problem if we didn't have our converter

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed on the Tropical (Suites) side, but had a chance to see one of the Sirenis Cocotal rooms - and they are equally as nice - just no separate living area.
reviews.title: Fun and casual, important things done right!

likes.liked: — Exceptional service, great beach, easy layout and size

reviews.text: The resort seems to be a bit older than the Barcelo - but it in no way lacks for anything (except for the electrical outlets - required converter for some hair appliances, while others worked OK - depends on the appliance).
reviews.title: Nice hotel, not many Americans

likes.liked: — The grounds were beatiful and there were many different areas to the resort
likes.disliked: — Lack of communication on the staff's part on activities going on at the property - i.e. no daily flyer with schedule, etc

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was most impressed by the grounds - they were extremely beautiful and well-cared for. The attention to detail did not stop there. Staff were constantly cleaning, tidying, organizing - everyone from the gardeners to the managers took great pride in maintaining this resort. Everywhere was service with a smile and if you can learn a bit of Spanish before you go, the staff love to chat! Security was fabulous. There was one instance where a guest started to get a little loud (one in every crowd!) and the security was on the spot from no where and diffusing the situation. (Hope this is OK to post, but I feel it is very important).
reviews.title: Mar.5-19th 2008

reviews.text: The food was great. Last year, didn't find the food bad, but didn't find it anything to rave about. Here at the Sirenis - even the buffet was appetizing and had a great variety each nite. The al a carte restaurants were also great - we had the Italian, the Mexican and the Japanese. Note re the a la carte - you can only book one per day per room - so go early when guest services opens.
reviews.title: Trip of a Lifetime!!

likes.disliked: — Alot of children, unable to snorkel

reviews.text: It was my first experience in an all inclusive trip. I just loved it. Wonderful personal. Above all was Jansen (ANIMATION SUPER!). I loved the Karaoke evening. Loved the disco and dances. The weather was excellent in July (Back here is too hot). My wife and I enjoyed our stay. Will come back again for longer (15 days). People from all over the world were very nice. The Dominicans are so friendly. Hard working animation team. GREAT VACATION!
reviews.title: Wanna go back Now

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fancy a little ching ching, whilst enjoying the hot summer days in the carribean?
reviews.title: Casino Royale

reviews.text: Well ask yourself a few things first...
reviews.title: Lovely holiday experience!
14 days better spent somewhere else!!!
reviews.text: Do you like sweating so much you can actually see the dirt emerge from your skin?
Do you like being robbed blind?
reviews.title: Nice Vacation - June 24 to Jul 1 - Toronto Canada

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After seeing some of the bad reviews on Tropical Suites and the very resonable price we were a little worried. Our experience was nothing short of Fantastic!!! The resort was beautiful, very well kept and the pool...Oh my gosh!! The Food Was Very Good With My Favorite being The buffet. WeTried The Steak, Italian And The Chinese And They Were All Good But The Buffet Had Great Made To Order Selections. We Found Booking The ALA CARTE Very easy. The Best Thing About The Resort Was The People Who Worked there. They Were EXTREMELY FRIENDLY And Helpful And THE BARTENDERS were great!! IF You Go Ask For A MIKE ESPECIAL (FRESH SQUEEZED ORANGES AND LEMONS WITH SMIRNOFF). Trust Me They Will Remember...MIKE AND LORETTA
reviews.title: The People Made This Place Fantastic!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I feel compelled to write something on this site after my stay due to having read some very mixed reviews about this hotel.
reviews.title: An excellent value hotel

likes.disliked: — some facilities closed as it was quiet season

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel probably isn't 5 star by our standards (more like a 3.5 *) but if it had been I'm sure I would have paid at least twice the amount. The hotel is a little dated in some places but they were doing some small renovations whilst we were there (around the pool side bar and blocks of apartments).
reviews.title: Spectacular Sirenis - Loved Every Minute!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel and grounds were always constantly being cleaned / attented to. Had we had some of the complaints that people had mentioned on here, we would have definately asked to be moved - but gladly no need to because our room was fine.
reviews.title: Best Holiday With My Girlfriend

likes.liked: — The entire resort, the sun sea and sand
likes.disliked: — Could have been abit more 5 star eg refurbish/repaint of some bits

reviews.title: 3rd visit- stayed here, 2004, 2005 & 2006
reviews.text: A couple of gripes were that as it seemed to be a failrly quiet time, a few bars were closed and sometimes in the evening they had some people selling necklaces and cigars that were far too pushy to get you to buy stuff.

reviews.title: Beautiful......
reviews.text: I stayed @ Sirenis tropical From April 5th to April 12th with my spouse and 2 other couples and had a wonderful time. Check in was my biggest problem. our room was not ready for about 2 hours after we got there so it was a little frustrating waiting around for it. After that we had a wonder ful experience. the service was excellent, very friendly staff, very clean grounds. Ate at the steak house-pretty good, mexican-loved it, and italian-pretty good, buffet was repeditive but always found something to eat. loved the ice cream at the snack bar, just like McDonalds!! The entertainment was of great variety really enjoyed it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went on the excursion "tropical Strom" full day and loved it . one big party all day long. the weather all week long was beautiful, 42C one day!!!!! My only other complaint is that there were no clocks in the rooms, so bring a watch! i would definitely recommend this resort to a friend!!
reviews.title: Room for improvement

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a mixed experience. The beach was beautiful, the waiters were really nice and there was always a good choice of food at every meal. However, we were extremely frustrated by the whole long chair reservation experience. We are early risers and at 7 am all the best places were reserved with everything from towels to hats and flip flops and this the night before. We were stunned to see these people take possession of their chairs at 10-11 am since they obviously did not have to rush having already gotten the best places. This is the first time I see such a practice. The front desk was also not very good at following up on request such as looking after a broken air conditioner. I also had to go looking for the cleaning lady on two occasions torequest towels from her as well as shampoo as they were not always automatically replaced. Minior detail but useful:The tv remote did not work unless you called the front desk and got the code, a detail they fail to mention when you check in. Make sure you also specify one bed as most rooms have two small beds which we found out upon opening our bedroom door.The ride to the hitel was about an hour long. Ours wasn't so bumpy. Probably because we travelled to and from the resort during the day and the driver was able to avoid all the potholes.
reviews.title: Good Value Overall

reviews.text: I visited Sirenis March 28-April1and, despite a rough start, the resort provided just what was needed to relax and enjoy the Dominican Republic. Some things you might want to know:
reviews.title: Not going Back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -The bus ride to this resort, unfortunately, is brutal. it is one of the last on the strip of resorts, which comes with other benefits (secluded, long beach, quiet). It may benefit you to take motion sickness medicine after landing at the airport before the ride (and I have a pretty strong stomach).
reviews.title: PEI Travellers

reviews.text: My daughter and I spent the week of Nov. 25 to Dec. 1 at this resort. Overall, we had a great time - here are my notes in short:
reviews.title: Not bad at all !!

likes.liked: — Size of Room and thank god for the TVs
likes.disliked: — Bed and Pillows definitely need to be replaced with comfortable ones.

reviews.text: - Food - we ate at the buffet everytime - lots to choose from - amazing salads, great bread - had absolutely no problem finding something nice to eat - fresh fruit juice for breakfast - fresh fruit at lunch and dinner plus great deserts!
reviews.title: Vacation fro Hel

reviews.text: I have been to 3 different resorts in DR and Sirenis was the best! The food at the resturants is out of this world, we only got the chance to eat at the italian and mexican but they were both amazing! The service was superior and staff very friendly. The pool was clean and so beautiful! I highly recommend the resort and will be going back.
reviews.title: Best resort in DR

reviews.text: We were 4 adults, 1 child and 1 baby travelling from PORTUGAL.
reviews.title: Excellent vacations. Great resort.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spend a great time at this resort.
reviews.title: Would go back anytime!!!

likes.liked: — Very friendly staff around the restaurant and pool
likes.disliked: — The whole reserving the hut in the morning.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was ok, but they could have more child/baby options,
reviews.title: Very Impressed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: beach and pool great, animations great.
reviews.title: very dissapointed of 5 stars resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Trip advisor was very helpful in choosing this resort and most of the reviews are very accurate. I liked this resort a lot but you definitely have to go into it with a certain level of expectations and expect things to not go perfectly. I am 30 years old and I went with my GF for 4 nights to the Sirenus Tropical Suites .This was my first trip to a DR resort, and outside of Cancun my first resort ever.
reviews.title: A few Annoyances but Very Good Overall

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The good: The resort was huge and clean and the staff was very friendly. The pool was amazing and huge, the beach was big and very nice. The drinks available were extensive. If you ask for Bacardi or Stoli Vodka or Bialy’s you can get it. Its hidden underneath every bar so you have to ask for it or you will be drinking local liquor. There was always something to do whether it be beach volleyball, pool volleyball, soccer, water polo, tennis, horse back riding, shows at night (which were very entertaing and I recommend all of them, but again don’t expect Broadway shows). The rooms were very clean. Now the all important food issue.
reviews.title: Great Vacation.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The buffet is decent and you will find something you like each day and night ( I would not want to eat it 7 days straight for a week but you will do just fine for a few nights a week if you look around). The restaurants are all good. The Mexican, Italian and Japanese all had some very good dishes. I highly recommend them over the buffet but you must get on line in the morning to make reservation. Dispite the fact they are half full the resort will not let you attend usually without a reservation. We did get a few bad dishes but we just sent them back for something we liked a lot better. We always ended up with a very good meal. Wine with dinner and champagne at the lobby bar is the way to go.
reviews.title: nice 4 stars hotels

reviews.text: The Bad: Getting there was hell. It’s a 1 hour bumpy ride from the airport and our driver almost crash 2-3 times. Once we got there at 3pm our room was not ready and they TWICE brought us to a room that was taken. After 2 hours of walking around the resort we complained straight to management and we were immediately put in a nicer room by the beach. This was the worst part of the whole trip and after this it was smooth sailing and a great time. I will warn you not to expect too much from the mixed drinks. The Pina Colada’s and Strawberry Daquari and Margaritas left a lot to be desired. (they all use the same mix which makes no sense). I kept to the Bacardi, Stoli, Baily’s ,Wine and Champange the whole time. The staff didn’t speak English at all and that was the one frustrating thing throughout the whole trip. In fact very few guests seem to be from America. Most were British or French. If you are single this is probably not the best place to go though.
reviews.title: Wow!!! I'm so impress!!!

likes.disliked: — Family resort...lots of kids......but didn't find it bothering!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In short if you tamper your expectations and expect some annoyances I think you will be very happy with this resort considering the very low price compared to other resorts at its level. If you have a nice driver from the airport you probably wont mind driving the extra 30 min to save a lot of money. Just don’t expect check in to go smooth from what I read and what I saw.
reviews.title: Cape Breton Girl

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel for 2 weeks at end of September 2007. Have actually just arrived home this morning! We were allocated on arrival and so were a little worried as to what accomodation we would get. We did not have to worry. The hotel was fantastic. I
reviews.title: Fantastic 4 star hotel, could not fault it.

likes.disliked: — Would have to say the surrounding area was quiet as it is an up and coming tourist resort

reviews.title: Outstanding Stay at the Sirenis Tropical
reviews.text: feel that it is correctly graded as a 4 star but is one of the best 4 star properties I have stayed in. I could not fault it. The staff were all friendly and accomodting. The room (which had a seperate living room) was clean and spacious. The food was fantastic. Obviously buffets get a bit repetative but there was nothing that was not fresh or looked unappetising. Everything was cooked properly and well presented. The pool area is huge with plenty of sunbeds. The hotel was only at 60% capacity when we stayed there though. At weekends Dominicans use the hotel and it did seem a lot busier but that was probably because it had been pretty quiet the rest of the week.

reviews.title: Best Ever!!
reviews.text: I really could not fault this hotel in any area.

My husband and I were very skeptical of this resort after looking at all the reviews on this site. But I have to say that we were ecstatic to find that this resort is absolutely awesome. We enjoyed everything about the resort, the staff, the food, the entertainment, and even the shopping.
reviews.title: forget all bad reviews

reviews.text: The resort: The trip from the airport was not as bad as we expected. It is an hour long bus ride but gives you time to see the island, the landscape, the foliage, and the animals on the various farms. All tourists are greeted with a Tropicale Breeze refreshment, my personal favorite, while they wait to check in. Check in was quick. We were at the end of the line and waited maybe 10 minutes. Our luggage was taken to our room and we decided to book our first night's a la carte dinner at this time so we could get a jump on it. We had read a lot of reviews that said it was difficult to book them but we found it was not a problem at all. Julio took care of us and we were given prime treatment from him!
reviews.title: Hungry for a caterpiller?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Sirenis Tropical Suites from 14-21 April 2008. We had seen the Sirenis Cocotal advertised for £300 pp more, but went with the Tropical Suites. Good job, since all the facilities are shared, there are just separate check in and guest service desks, but you could use either anyway! In fact, I'm glad we went for Tropical Suites as we often were in bed before 10pm, and if we had been on the Cocotal side I think the noise of the entertainment would have disturbed us.
reviews.title: Well worth the long journey
Nice resort, but not a 4 1/2 or 5 star as we were told
reviews.text: Our room was in the building with the reception and buffet restaurants (A), on the top floor. We never expected anything amazing as we had booked only 2 weeks prior to travel, but it more than met our needs with 2 double beds which we put together and a fridge full of water, sprite and coca cola. My only criticism of the particular room we had would be that the shower took some time to get warm, you had to guess which way to turn it to get hot water, and that the roof of our balcony was made of palm leaves so when it rained the balcony was out of use for several hours... nice nesting place for birds though!

The grounds are amazing and the staff obviously take great pride in them as we found lots of staff consantly tending to the gardens. Two nights one of the frogs in the fountain was turned round... was put back straight by the staff very quickly!
reviews.title: Definitely a 4 star resort

likes.liked: — Cafe con Leche, pool and beach

reviews.text: We used the pool several times during our stay, great for everyone with varying depths. I don't know how often it is cleaned but there seemed to be quite a lot of leaves etc in it, and a very bad smell when sitting at the swin up bar on the Tropical Suites side. We never went to the pool before 10am, and there was rarely a shaded area to sit which is annoying but I have never been anywhere where that isn't the case. I liked the fact you were given 'towel keys' which you changed for towels to use at the pool/on the beach, and you could change for new ones when they got wet. Some people have said the $20 charge for a lost towel/towel key is harsh but I suppose it just ensures you don't dump them. Maybe this facility should be optional?
reviews.title: Good Family Vacation

likes.disliked: — Buffet menu and the tired looking rooms

reviews.text: The beach was amazing, quite windy though. Again there were rarely shaded areas to sit but we tended to walk up and down rather than sit and bathe. I just wish there were less men trying to sell you paintings - we only walked northwards once because of an overly persistent seller.
reviews.title: Had a wonderful time

likes.disliked: — Key cards, needed to be reprogrammed frequently.

reviews.text: Just got back from Sirenis Tropical Suites. We had a two-week stay Dec 15-29/07. We are a family of four who are experienced travellers. We have been to about 20 all-inclusive vacations at various high-end and low-end resorts in the Caribbean, DR, Cuba and Mexico. Our family had a lot of strong feelings about this resort, our fellow travellers and the whole experience, so here goes......
reviews.title: Great Value for the Money

likes.liked: — Beach and Pool scene, friendly and prompt service

reviews.text: The Good:
reviews.title: Another Day in Paradise

likes.liked: — Cleanliness of the resort and very friendly staff
likes.disliked: — There were no NON SMOKING sections anywhere.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1. Beach was long, clean and just beautiful. Fine brown sand and no rocks. Red flags were up for a few days, but ocean was still swimmable.
reviews.title: Overall success

reviews.text: 2. Pool scene was excellent - clean, large areas for swimming. Shallow areas for kids. Plenty of stuff going on, lots of bars and snack areas to eat lunch, get ice cream etc. Best of all, the pools are very close to the beach so you can alternate back and forth during the day without a lot of walking. Alejandro and Willy at the Beach Bar were excellent!
reviews.title: Not comparable to other 4 1/2 stars

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 3. Service was EXCELLENT from just about everyone - Restaurant workers (thank you to Juan and many others), chambermaids, Animation team ("Action Jackson", Spaghetti), Gardeners, Front Desk - you name it. The people who say the Staff were rude were obviously rude to everyone themselves. Remember the golden rule people! Tipping and gift giving was appreciated, but not necessary to get good service. We brought a lot of children's Christmas gifts down for the locals - this is a very heartwarming thing to do and seemed to go over even better than money tips.
reviews.title: Amazing vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food: amazing. That resort has seven restaurants; we went to four of them and just loved the food. Our favorite was a seafood restaurant. I am not a picky eater, but I am not a fast food junky either. I enjoy nice restaurants as well as nice home cooked meal, so for me the food was very good. Also, I always wonder when people say there is not much of a variety; I wonder what these people cook at home…how much variety do you get at home, cooking Monday to Friday after work. But that’s just me…
reviews.title: 6lbs heavier... weightwatchers here I come (AGAIN)

reviews.text: Entertainment: amazing. The animation team works really hard from morning till night and the shows were just amazing. Every day we were looking forward to going to the Theater to watch the shows. Also, they have all sorts of different activities going on during the day at the beach and the pool. We went to the disco every night and had a great time dancing salsa, merenge and bachata.
reviews.title: Definitely a great resort!

reviews.text: Worst service ever. Most ignorant people I have seen serving tourists. Disgusting, dirty rooms. Problem with towels, water. Very dusty, cobweb everywhere, broken, tired furniture. I will rate this hotel max 3.5 stars. Tips made no difference at all.
reviews.title: worst vacation ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived on the 13th of Dec. to some very windy weather but the temperature was still warm. We stayed for a week. We got on our bus and then they realized there wasn't enough room on the bus for all of us so our friends and us went on a seperate smaller bus. It was an interesting experience! The horn there is used to say hi as well as get out of the way or I'm passing you. Very different! We got to the resort and our rooms weren't ready since the water had been off all day and they needed to clean the room. We sat at the bar then went to eat at the buffet. The food was delicious and very diverse. We got to our rooms and our luggage was there waiting for us which was nice. The rooms are comfortable and the air conditioning worked really well. The tv stations worked most of the time but there wasn't one that had the correct time! The weather was a little rough the first couple days, it rained a bit in the mornings but we still managed to get some sun. My husband and my girlfriend's husband played beach volleyball every day. It was great. I played a couple times and most people were very curtious and fun-loving...a few were obnoxious and bossy but hey, you just choose to ignore those people. We did the catamaran and the sea kayaks and that was really fun and free. We went on one excursion, the Marinarium snorkeling with the rays and sharks. We LOVED this excursion! The service was friendly and they got you dancing and involved in stuff on the boat. If you want to do any shopping on the beach stay away from the right side...they try to rob you blind! Julio on the left side and the people at Nicole's Shop were reasonable and helpful. They take American traveler's checks at Nicole's. We ate at the steakhouse twice and the Italien twice. We had no problems with reservations but we were pretty flexible as far as when we wanted to go. The food was very good but I prefered the Italien. The wings at the steakhouse were also good but the ribs weren't that good. The buffet was also very good and diverse in the selection even for breakfast. Fresh fruit and juice every morning, omelets to order, and all kinds of Dominican food. The service was excellent and friendly and the same people worked there moning, noon and night. They are definitely a hard working group! The only negative thing we found was that prople smoked everywhere! Now, we live in a country were it's smoke-free pretty much everywhere so we are a little spoiled but even in the restaurants while we were eating people would light up. It was hard to find a spot where you weren't inundated with cigarette smoke. If they had a non-smoking area in the restaurants and in the lobby it would make a world of difference. If people want to smoke, i don't have a problem with it...I just don't want to eat it with my meals. Other than that and a few rude Europians who stand in your way on the plane while you're trying to watch a movie, it was a great experience. If you can stand the smoke, I would highly recommend this resort but if you can't, stay away. I won't be back there unless they add non-smoking areas.
reviews.title: Great stay but too many smokers

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I travelled to the Domincan Republic on Nov 22nd for a fortnight. We stayed at the Serenis Tropical Suites in Ulvero Alto.
reviews.title: Amazing time at the Serenis!

reviews.text: Flight there:- We flew with My Travel from Gatwick via Manchester(we did already know this prior to our trip) On arrival in Manchester we were told there was a 'fault' with the door on the plane and would have to disembark. After 1.5 hrs we boarded a Thomas Cook plane and set off! (We later found out that they do this regulary!!!) Flight was fine no problems made up some time in the air and arrived about 230pm in the afternoon. Having already been to the DR and Punta Canan I knew what to expect on arrival and it all ran smoothly and we were on our air conditioned transfer buses in no time. Yes the roads are very bumpy so be prepared and there are no rules on how to drive it seems and quite frequently they change sides of the road! I would not reccommend driving out there during your stay.
reviews.title: Absolutely loved the resort...will go back!!

likes.disliked: — The beds and pillows were terrible!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel- On arrival we were greeted with a refreshing cocktail and check in ran very smoothly and we set off to our room which was T101. We got everything we requested,a gorgeous sea view on the first floor. The rooms are very basic but very clean and served there purpose well. My only comment is that the A/C was very tempremental so didnt use it much and at this time of the year wasnt a problem.
reviews.title: Best vacation
would go back tomorrow
reviews.text: hola!
Just got back from a week at the Sirenis Tropical Suites and had a great time. I would rate this hotel a 4 star overall, as was advertised with my tour operator.
reviews.title: Sirenis Tropical..the good, the bad and the ugly!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Grounds: the grounds of this hotel are beautiful. The walkway down the middle played music (which I loved because it reminded me of Canada's Wonderland for you all you Toronto area people). The layout of the resort makes it easy to get to everything.
reviews.title: Wonderful Vacation

reviews.text: Pool: I'm not a "pool person" but this pool was gorgeous! It is the longest pool I've ever been to and many areas are over 7 ft. There are also a ton of shallow areas and 2 pool bars at opposite ends. You most definately have one drink finished before you can swim to the bar at the other end of the pool.
reviews.title: Not a 5 star!

reviews.text: Beach: AWESOME!!! the sand was golden soft brown and the water was warm and crystal blue. There is a lot of coral with tropical fish (even in close so everybody can snorkle if they wish). Bring a roll from the buffet and feed the fish...they love it and you get some great pictures. The pool and beach always had tons of available loungers.
reviews.title: best holiday so far
Sirenis is brilliant!!!
reviews.text: Never been all inclusive nor to Dominican before, but Sirenis was brilliant.

Staff are very pleasant and can't do enough for you. They're all so happy!! Grounds were gorgeous, beach was like it was out of a picture postcard, food and drinks were amazing and the place was really spotless. Choice of mexican, italian, japanese, american, dominican etc food through a choice of different restaurants you could book into on site, or just two huge buffet restaurants serving continental food. All really, really great food.
reviews.title: A hidden Jem +++++

reviews.text: Lots of nighttime entertainment too, plus a outdoor theatre and disco on site which was funny!! Did 3 trips....helicopter trip (astounding!!), swam with sharks and stingrays (amazing!!) and went over to Saona Island (DEFINITELY recommend it).
reviews.title: So So

reviews.text: Would go back tomorrow if I could, definitely going back next year. Is the sort of place where you could feel really safe on your own as well.
reviews.title: much better than I thought
More Than Expected
reviews.text: ONE IMPORTANT THING: Book with Thomson or a proper tour operator....we booked through a smaller website and ended up with HOLA TOURS (Dominican based) who were bloody awful, didn't arrange any of our pre-paid airport transfers (stranded at the airport isn't nice!), and left it five days to even say hello and tell us to book all trips through them (hello? we'd already done 2!!). Absolutely rubbish.
